events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle colliding with another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords referencing a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to assist the customer with the next steps of the claim process.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
The customer was asked to provide a police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the vehicle registration.
All requested documents including the police report and vehicle photos were submitted by the customer for review.
The investigation team began examining the claim details and verifying the circumstances of the accident.
The investigation concluded that the claim is valid and there were no discrepancies in the accident report.
A fair settlement offer based on the damage assessment and policy terms was proposed to the customer.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed gratitude for the prompt handling.
The claim received final approval after the customer accepted the settlement terms without any objections.
The agreed settlement amount was successfully disbursed to the customer's account covering repair costs.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that issue is resolved.
The claim files and documents were archived in the system for future reference and regulatory compliance purposes.
